info.title: SeaX Bulk SMS
info.description:
- [Overview](#section/Overview)
- [Quick Start](#section/Quick-Start)
- [Authorization](#section/Authorization)
- [Features](#section/Features)

## Overview
SeaX Bulk SMS helps you manage communication with customers through SMS/MMS.

### Send
1. Send Bulk SMS/MMS
2. Schedule send up to 7 days in advance
2. Respect "Do Not Contact"
3. View the Delivery Report
4. Send from multiple numbers

### Receive
1. Capture auto opt-in and opt-out
2. Receive customer replies and text back

### Contact Management
1. Import/export contact list
2. Assign multiple labels to contact
3. Group contacts by the label to Bulk Send

## Quick Start
### Sending a campaign
#### 1. Follow the steps in [Authorization](#section/Authorization) to generate APIKey to authorize your request

#### 2. Import contacts
1. [Import contacts](#tag/contact/operation/import_contacts_api_v1_workspace__workspace_id__import_contacts_post).
2. [Get job status](#tag/jobs/operation/get_job_api_v1_workspace__workspace_id__jobs__job_id__get) by job_id from previous step. If the status of the `job` is `finished` or `failed`, it means the progress of importing contacts is over.

#### 3. Launch campaign
1. [Send a campaign](#tag/campaigns/operation/create_campaign_api_v1_workspace__workspace_id__campaigns_post).
2. [Get job status](#tag/jobs/operation/get_job_api_v1_workspace__workspace_id__jobs__job_id__get) by job_id from previous step.
If the status of the `job` is `finished` or `failed`, it means the progress of the campaign is over.
3. [Check the result of campaign](#tag/campaigns/operation/list_campaign_logs_api_v1_workspace__workspace_id__campaigns__campaign_id__logs_get).

### Sending an SMS/MMS
#### 1. [Get the id of the sender phone.](#tag/phones/operation/get_phones_api_v1_workspace__workspace_id__phones_get)
#### 2. [Send an SMS/MMS from the sender's phone with its id to the contact phone.](#tag/messages/operation/send_message_api_v1_workspace__workspace_id__send_message_post)

### Contact Management
#### 1. Create contacts with RESTful APIs
1. [Create contact labels.](#tag/contact_label/operation/create_contact_label_api_v1_workspace__workspace_id__contact_labels_post)
2. [Create contacts with contact labels.](#tag/contact/operation/create_contact_api_v1_workspace__workspace_id__contacts_post)

#### 2. Create contacts by importing CSV
1. [Import contacts](#tag/contact/operation/import_contacts_api_v1_workspace__workspace_id__import_contacts_post).
2. [Get job status](#tag/jobs/operation/get_job_api_v1_workspace__workspace_id__jobs__job_id__get) by job_id from previous step. If the status of the `job` is `finished` or `failed`, it means the progress of importing contacts is over.


## Authorization
### Access token and refresh token
The `access token` is for authorization and the `refresh token` is to get a new `access token` when the old one is expired. The detailed description is here https://seaauth.seasalt.ai/redoc.
1. [Login into SeaAuth](https://seaauth.seasalt.ai/redoc#tag/users/operation/login_api_v1_users_login_post) with scope `seax-bulk-sms`. The scope value would authorize the access token to use the endpoint of SeaX Bulk SMS.
2. Add `access token` to the header `Authorization` with the `Bearer` prefix, for example, `Authorization`:`Bearer eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1...`.

### API Key
Because the `access token` has a limit lifetime, it is inconvenient for backend integration to refresh after expiration. There is an `API Key` that would not expire until you refresh it. Here is how you can get a
`API Key`.
1. [Create API Key](#tag/api_keys/operation/reset_api_key_api_v1_workspace__workspace_id__api_keys_reset_post).
2. Add APIKey to the header `X-API-Key`.

<!-- ## Features
### Auto reply with Keyword
#### What is the keyword?
When an inbound message from the contact is sent to your phone, the keyword would try to match the message and do the following two things:
1. Automatically respond to the contact of an inbound message with a defined reply message.
2. Add the defined labels to the contact of the inbound message.

#### How do keywords work?
The matching process works as below:
1. Match the message with system DNC words `stop`, `unsubscribe`, `remove me`, `stop sending me messages`, `wrong person`, and `wrong number`. If it matched, Add the system
label `DNC` to the contact and reply to the contact with `dnc_reply_message` if the `enabled_dnc_reply` of your phone is `True`.
2. If no match in Step 1. Match the message with the keywords associated with your phone in order of priority. When it matches, there is fine-grained control of automatic reply and adding a label with `enabled_auto_reply` and `enabled_contact_label`.
3. If no match in Step 2. Reply to the contact with `generic_reply_message` if the `enabled_generic_reply` of your phone is `True`. -->

post.description:
Import contacts from csv. The csv should have these headers
    - name
    - phone
    - whatsapp (show or hide based on the setting)
    - labels

    Other header will be consider as custom contact fields.

# The example of raw csv:
    # 'new_field' will be custom field.
    # Phone is optional - if omitted, contact will be created without SMS capability
    name,phone,whatsapp,labels,new_field
    new_customer,+12345678900,+12345678900,"test,test3",2
    whatsapp_only_customer,,+12345678901,"test",1

campaign_type.title: campaign_type
campaign_type.description: Type of call campaign. Only AI_AGENT is currently supported for AI-powered conversations.

destinations.title: destinations
destinations.description: List of recipients for this campaign. Each destination includes the phone number, optional recipient name, and optional message variables for personalization.

ai_agent_id.title: ai_agent_id
ai_agent_id.description: ID of the AI agent to use for this call campaign. Must be configured with SEAX_CALL integration. You can find the AI agent ID in the SeaChat website URL: https://chat.seasalt.ai/gpt/workspace/{workspace_id}/bot/{ai_agent_id}/... The ai_agent_id is the UUID in the URL path after '/bot/'.

message.title: message
message.description: Optional custom starting message for the AI agent. If provided, this will be the first message the AI agent says when the call is answered, overriding the default starting message configured in SeaChat. Use {field_name} placeholders for personalization with message variables. Variable names are case-insensitive - both {First_Name} and {first_name} will work. Example: 'Hello {first_name}, this is a call about your account.'

start_time.title: start_time
start_time.description: UTC timestamp when the campaign should start executing. If not provided, the campaign starts immediately upon creation.

end_time.title: end_time
end_time.description: UTC timestamp when the campaign should stop executing. If not provided, the campaign will continue until all destinations are processed.

destination.title: destination
destination.description: Phone number of the recipient in E.164 format (e.g., +1234567890). Must be a valid phone number.

name.title: name
name.description: Optional name for this recipient. If provided, this name will be used for the contact. If not provided, defaults to 'Call Campaign Contact {phone_number}'.

message_variables.title: message_variables
message_variables.description: Dynamic message variables for this specific recipient. Key-value pairs replace {key} placeholders in the message template. Variable names are case-insensitive - both {First_Name} and {first_name} will work. Example: {'First_Name': 'John', 'Last_Name': 'Doe'} for message 'Hello {first_name} {last_name}'.

id.description: Unique identifier for the created call campaign.

name.title: campaign_name

destination.title: destination
destination.description: WhatsApp phone number of the recipient in international format (e.g., +1234567890). Must be a valid WhatsApp number.

parameters.title: parameters
parameters.description: Dynamic body text parameters for this specific recipient. Values replace {{1}}, {{2}}, etc. placeholders in the template body. Overrides global parameters if provided. Example: ['John', 'Doe'] for template 'Hello {{1}} {{2}}'.

buttons_parameters.title: buttons_parameters
buttons_parameters.description: Dynamic button parameters for this specific recipient. Values replace button text placeholders. Currently used for quick reply buttons with variable content. Overrides global button parameters if provided.

header_parameters.title: header_parameters
header_parameters.description: Dynamic header parameters for this specific recipient. For TEXT headers: values replace {{1}} placeholders. For MEDIA headers: provide URLs for images/videos/documents. Overrides global header parameters if provided.

is_specific_header_parameters.title: is_specific_header_parameters
is_specific_header_parameters.description: Indicates whether this recipient has recipient-specific header parameters that differ from the global template header parameters.

components.title: components
components.description: **Destination-specific components** - Override campaign-level components to send personalized content to this recipient. Uses the same structure as [Meta's Components API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp-business-management-api/message-templates/components) and [Postman reference](https://www.postman.com/meta/whatsapp-business-platform/folder/dybfz7u/components-object). Supports header (text/image/video/document), body (named/positional parameters), and button components (URL/coupon codes). Mutually exclusive with parameters/header_parameters/buttons_parameters. Destination-specific example: {'destinations': [{'destination': '+11234567890', 'components': [{'type': 'body', 'parameters': [{'type': 'text', 'parameter_name': 'name', 'text': 'Alice'}]}]}, {'destination': '+10987654321', 'components': [{'type': 'body', 'parameters': [{'type': 'text', 'parameter_name': 'name', 'text': 'Bob'}]}]}]}

CampaignHSMWhatsAppDestinationInterface.title: CampaignHSMWhatsAppDestinationInterface
CampaignHSMWhatsAppDestinationInterface.description: Mixin to validate mutual exclusivity between components and legacy parameters.

template.title: template
template.description: Name of the Meta-approved WhatsApp Business template to use. Must match exactly with a template in your WhatsApp Business Account.

language_code.title: language_code
language_code.description: Language code of the template. Must match the language the template was approved in. Common values: 'en' for English, 'es' for Spanish, etc.

destinations.title: destinations
destinations.description: List of recipients for this campaign. Each destination includes the phone number and optional personalized parameters.

parameters.title: parameters
parameters.description: Global body text parameters applied to all recipients. Values replace {{1}}, {{2}}, etc. in template body. Recipient-specific parameters override these values.

buttons_parameters.title: buttons_parameters
buttons_parameters.description: Global button parameters applied to all recipients. Used for quick reply buttons with variable content. Recipient-specific button parameters override these values.

header_parameters.title: header_parameters
header_parameters.description: Global header parameters applied to all recipients. For TEXT headers: replace {{1}} placeholders. For MEDIA headers: provide media URLs. Recipient-specific header parameters override these values.

components.title: components
components.description: **Campaign-level components (global)** - Applied to all recipients unless overridden by destination-specific components. Uses the same structure as [Meta's Components API](https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp-business-management-api/message-templates/components) and [Postman reference](https://www.postman.com/meta/whatsapp-business-platform/folder/dybfz7u/components-object). Supports header (text/image/video/document), body (named/positional parameters), and button components (URL/coupon codes). Mutually exclusive with parameters/header_parameters/buttons_parameters. Example: {'language_code': 'en_US', 'destinations': [{'destination': '+11234567890'}, {'destination': '+10987654321'}], 'components': [{'type': 'body', 'parameters': [{'type': 'text', 'parameter_name': 'company', 'text': 'Seasalt.ai'}]}]}

all_contact_label_ids.title: All Contact Label Ids
all_contact_label_ids.description:
Include contacts that have ALL of these labels (AND logic). Use this when contacts must have every specified label to be included in the campaign.

**How to get label IDs:**
```
GET /api/v1/workspace/{workspace_id}/contact_labels
```
Response: `{"data": [{"id": "label-uuid", "name": "VIP", ...etc}]}`

any_contact_label_ids.title: Any Contact Label Ids
any_contact_label_ids.description:
Include contacts that have ANY of these labels (OR logic). Use this for broader targeting when contacts need only one of the specified labels.

**How to get label IDs:**
```
GET /api/v1/workspace/{workspace_id}/contact_labels
```
Response: `{"data": [{"id": "label-uuid", "name": "Premium", ...etc}]}`

exclude_contact_ids.title: Exclude Contact Ids
exclude_contact_ids.description:
Exclude specific contacts by their IDs. Use this to remove individual contacts from the campaign, even if they match other inclusion criteria.

**How to get contact IDs:**
```
GET /api/v1/workspace/{workspace_id}/contacts?limit=50
```
Response: `{"data": [{"id": "contact-uuid", "name": "John",  ...etc}]}`

addition_contact_ids.title: Addition Contact Ids
addition_contact_ids.description:
Force include specific contacts by their IDs. These contacts will be included regardless of label filters. Useful for ensuring VIP contacts are always included.

**How to get contact IDs:**
```
GET /api/v1/workspace/{workspace_id}/contacts?limit=50
```
Response: `{"data": [{"id": "contact-uuid", "name": "Jane",  ...etc}]}`

exclude_any_contact_label_ids.title: Exclude Any Contact Label Ids
exclude_any_contact_label_ids.description: Exclude contacts that have ANY of these labels (OR exclusion logic). If a contact has even one of these labels, they will be excluded from the campaign.

exclude_all_contact_label_ids.title: Exclude All Contact Label Ids
exclude_all_contact_label_ids.description: Exclude contacts that have ALL of these labels (AND exclusion logic). Only contacts who have every one of these labels will be excluded.

keyword.title: Keyword
keyword.description: Include contacts whose name or phone number contains this keyword (partial match). Use this to target contacts based on name patterns or phone area codes.

whatsapp_phone_only.title: Whatsapp Phone Only
whatsapp_phone_only.description: When true, only include contacts that have verified WhatsApp numbers. This is essential for WhatsApp Business Platform campaigns and helps avoid delivery failures.

ContactFilterMixin.title: ContactFilterMixin
ContactFilterMixin.description:
Contact filtering mixin that defines how to select recipients for a campaign.

At least one filter parameter must be provided. Filters are applied in this order:
1. Include filters (any_contact_label_ids, all_contact_label_ids, addition_contact_ids, keyword)
2. Exclude filters (exclude_any_contact_label_ids, exclude_all_contact_label_ids, exclude_contact_ids)
3. Special filters (whatsapp_phone_only)

Example combinations:
- {"any_contact_label_ids": ["0354fb10-9e18-4923-a213-6253800f8d01",
  "11111111-2222-4444-3333-555555555555"]} - Include contacts with VIP OR Premium labels
- {"all_contact_label_ids": ["11111111-2222-4444-3333-666666666666",
  "22222222-3333-4444-5555-666666666666"]} - Include contacts with Customer AND Active labels
- {"any_contact_label_ids": ["11111111-2222-4444-3333-666666666666"],
  "exclude_any_contact_label_ids": ["33333333-4444-5555-6666-777777777777"]}
  - Include customers but exclude any unsubscribed

```
GET /api/v1/workspace/{workspace_id}/contact_labels
```
Response: `{"data": [{"id": "label-uuid", "name": "Premium", ...etc}]}`

exclude_contact_ids.title: Exclude Contact Ids
exclude_contact_ids.description:
Exclude specific contacts by their IDs. Use this to remove individual contacts from the campaign, even if they match other inclusion criteria.

**How to get contact IDs:**
```
GET /api/v1/workspace/{workspace_id}/contacts?limit=50
```
Response: `{"data": [{"id": "contact-uuid", "name": "John",  ...etc}]}`

addition_contact_ids.title: Addition Contact Ids
addition_contact_ids.description:
Force include specific contacts by their IDs. These contacts will be included regardless of label filters. Useful for ensuring VIP contacts are always included.

**How to get contact IDs:**
```
GET /api/v1/workspace/{workspace_id}/contacts?limit=50
```
Response: `{"data": [{"id": "contact-uuid", "name": "Jane",  ...etc}]}`

exclude_all_contact_label_ids.description: Exclude contacts that have ALL of these labels (AND exclusion logic). Only contacts who have every one of these labels will be excluded.

header_message.title: header_message
header_message.description: Content for the WhatsApp message template header. Supports template variables like {name}. Only applicable when type is WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_PLATFORM_MESSAGE.

message.title: message
message.description: The message content to be sent to recipients. Supports template variables like {name}, {phone}, etc. Required for SMS and MMS campaigns unless using AI agent.
message.example: Hi {name}, we have a special offer for you! Reply to learn more.

ai_agent_conversation_config_id.title: Ai Agent Conversation Config Id
ai_agent_conversation_config_id.description: AI agent associated conversation config ID.

is_timezone_aware.title: is_timezone_aware
is_timezone_aware.description: When true, the campaign will be sent based on each recipient's local timezone (if timezone data is available). When false, all messages are sent based on the system timezone.

is_schedule.title: Is Schedule
is_schedule.description: When true, this is a scheduled campaign that will send at the specified start_time. When false, the campaign will begin sending immediately after creation.

contact_file_url.title: contact_file_url
contact_file_url.description: The URL of the contact file contains contacts for this campaign.

all_contact_label_ids.title: All Contact Label Ids
all_contact_label_ids.description:
Include contacts that have ALL of these labels (AND logic). Use this when contacts must have every specified label to be included in the campaign.

**How to get label IDs:**
```
GET /api/v1/workspace/{workspace_id}/contact_labels
```
Response: `{"data": [{"id": "label-uuid", "name": "VIP", ...etc}]}`

any_contact_label_ids.title: Any Contact Label Ids
any_contact_label_ids.description:
Include contacts that have ANY of these labels (OR logic). Use this for broader targeting when contacts need only one of the specified labels.

**How to get label IDs:**
```
GET /api/v1/workspace/{workspace_id}/contact_labels
```
Response: `{"data": [{"id": "label-uuid", "name": "Premium", ...etc}]}`

exclude_contact_ids.title: Exclude Contact Ids
exclude_contact_ids.description:
Exclude specific contacts by their IDs. Use this to remove individual contacts from the campaign, even if they match other inclusion criteria.

**How to get contact IDs:**
```
GET /api/v1/workspace/{workspace_id}/contacts?limit=50
```
Response: `{"data": [{"id": "contact-uuid", "name": "John",  ...etc}]}`

addition_contact_ids.title: Addition Contact Ids
addition_contact_ids.description:
Force include specific contacts by their IDs. These contacts will be included regardless of label filters. Useful for ensuring VIP contacts are always included.

**How to get contact IDs:**
```
GET /api/v1/workspace/{workspace_id}/contacts?limit=50
```
Response: `{"data": [{"id": "contact-uuid", "name": "Jane",  ...etc}]}`

exclude_any_contact_label_ids.title: Exclude Any Contact Label Ids
exclude_any_contact_label_ids.description: Exclude contacts that have ANY of these labels (OR exclusion logic). If a contact has even one of these labels, they will be excluded from the campaign.

exclude_all_contact_label_ids.title: Exclude All Contact Label Ids
exclude_all_contact_label_ids.description: Exclude contacts that have ALL of these labels (AND exclusion logic). Only contacts who have every one of these labels will be excluded.

keyword.title: Keyword
keyword.description: Include contacts whose name or phone number contains this keyword (partial match). Use this to target contacts based on name patterns or phone area codes.

whatsapp_phone_only.title: Whatsapp Phone Only
whatsapp_phone_only.description: When true, only include contacts that have verified WhatsApp numbers. This is essential for WhatsApp Business Platform campaigns and helps avoid delivery failures.

header_format.title: header_format
header_format.description: Format of the WhatsApp message template header (TEXT, IMAGE, VIDEO, DOCUMENT). Only applicable when type is WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_PLATFORM_MESSAGE.

attach_contact_label_ids.title: attach_contact_label_ids
attach_contact_label_ids.description: Contact label IDs to automatically attach to all contacts who receive this campaign. This helps with future targeting.

phone_ids.title: phone_ids
phone_ids.description:
List of internal phone number IDs from your workspace to use as senders. These are your owned phone numbers that will send the messages.

**How to get phone IDs:**
```
GET /api/v1/workspace/{workspace_id}/phones
```
Response: `{"data": [{"id": "phone-uuid", "phone": "+15551234567", "type": "SMS", ...etc}]}`

Use the `id` field from the response.

message_service_id.title: message_service_id
message_service_id.description:
Twilio Messaging Service SID (starts with 'MG'). This is the Twilio service that will handle message delivery and phone number pool management.

**How to get message_service_id:**
```
GET /api/v1/workspace/{workspace_id}/messaging_services
```
Response: `{"data": [{"id": "MG123...", "friendly_name": "My Service", "status": "active"}]}`

Use the `id` field from the response.

enable_link_shortening.title: enable_link_shortening
enable_link_shortening.description: When true, URLs in the message content will be automatically shortened with link tracking. This helps with character count limits and provides click tracking analytics.

overwrite_phone_recipient.title: Overwrite Phone Recipient
overwrite_phone_recipient.description: Advanced: Allows overriding the default recipients configuration for the specified phone numbers. Only use this if you need to change which users can receive responses from this campaign.

contact_field_ids.title: Contact Field Ids
contact_field_ids.description:
List of contact field IDs that this campaign will use for personalization. These fields will be available as variables in the message template (e.g., {field_name}).

**How to get contact field IDs:**
```
GET /api/v1/workspace/{workspace_id}/contact_fields
```
Response: `{"data": [{"id": "field-uuid", "name": "appointment_date", "type": "date", ...etc}]}`

mode.title: mode
mode.description:
Campaign execution mode that determines how contacts are provided:
        - WEB: Contacts selected through web interface using label filters
        - WEBHOOK: Contacts provided via webhook API calls during campaign execution
        - EXCEL: Contacts uploaded via Excel/CSV file (requires contact_file_url)

stage.title: stage
stage.description:
Campaign lifecycle stage:
        - DRAFT: Campaign is saved but not ready for execution (can be edited)
        - INSTANCE: Campaign is finalized and ready for execution (limited editing)

relative_time_config.title: Relative Time Config
relative_time_config.description: Configuration for time-relative scheduling based on contact field values. This allows scheduling based on custom date fields in your contacts (e.g., send 2 days before appointment_date).

service_provider_campaign_data.title: Service Provider Campaign Data
service_provider_campaign_data.description: Required when type is WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_PLATFORM_MESSAGE. Contains WhatsApp Business Account details and template information needed to send WhatsApp template messages.

NewCampaign.title: NewCampaign
NewCampaign.description:
NewCampaign schema for creating a new messaging campaign.

This schema defines the structure for creating SMS, MMS, AI-powered, or WhatsApp Business
Platform messaging campaigns. Parameters have different requirements based on the campaign type.

Requirements by campaign type:
- SMS/MMS: Requires message, phone_ids, message_service_id
- AI_AGENT: Requires ai_agent_conversation_config_id, phone_ids, message_service_id
- WHATSAPP_BUSINESS_PLATFORM_MESSAGE: Requires service_provider_campaign_data, phone_ids

all_contact_label_ids.title: All Contact Label Ids
all_contact_label_ids.description:
Include contacts that have ALL of these labels (AND logic). Use this when contacts must have every specified label to be included in the campaign.

**How to get label IDs:**
```
GET /api/v1/workspace/{workspace_id}/contact_labels
```
Response: `{"data": [{"id": "label-uuid", "name": "VIP", ...etc}]}`

any_contact_label_ids.title: Any Contact Label Ids
any_contact_label_ids.description:
Include contacts that have ANY of these labels (OR logic). Use this for broader targeting when contacts need only one of the specified labels.

**How to get label IDs:**
```
GET /api/v1/workspace/{workspace_id}/contact_labels
```
Response: `{"data": [{"id": "label-uuid", "name": "Premium", ...etc}]}`

exclude_contact_ids.title: Exclude Contact Ids
exclude_contact_ids.description:
Exclude specific contacts by their IDs. Use this to remove individual contacts from the campaign, even if they match other inclusion criteria.

**How to get contact IDs:**
```
GET /api/v1/workspace/{workspace_id}/contacts?limit=50
```
Response: `{"data": [{"id": "contact-uuid", "name": "John",  ...etc}]}`

addition_contact_ids.title: Addition Contact Ids
addition_contact_ids.description:
Force include specific contacts by their IDs. These contacts will be included regardless of label filters. Useful for ensuring VIP contacts are always included.

**How to get contact IDs:**
```
GET /api/v1/workspace/{workspace_id}/contacts?limit=50
```
Response: `{"data": [{"id": "contact-uuid", "name": "Jane",  ...etc}]}`

exclude_any_contact_label_ids.title: Exclude Any Contact Label Ids
exclude_any_contact_label_ids.description: Exclude contacts that have ANY of these labels (OR exclusion logic). If a contact has even one of these labels, they will be excluded from the campaign.

exclude_all_contact_label_ids.title: Exclude All Contact Label Ids
exclude_all_contact_label_ids.description: Exclude contacts that have ALL of these labels (AND exclusion logic). Only contacts who have every one of these labels will be excluded.

all_contact_label_ids.title: All Contact Label Ids
all_contact_label_ids.description:
Include contacts that have ALL of these labels (AND logic). Use this when contacts must have every specified label to be included in the campaign.

**How to get label IDs:**
```
GET /api/v1/workspace/{workspace_id}/contact_labels
```
Response: `{"data": [{"id": "label-uuid", "name": "VIP", ...etc}]}`

any_contact_label_ids.title: Any Contact Label Ids
any_contact_label_ids.description:
Include contacts that have ANY of these labels (OR logic). Use this for broader targeting when contacts need only one of the specified labels.

**How to get label IDs:**
```
GET /api/v1/workspace/{workspace_id}/contact_labels
```
Response: `{"data": [{"id": "label-uuid", "name": "Premium", ...etc}]}`

exclude_contact_ids.title: Exclude Contact Ids
exclude_contact_ids.description:
Exclude specific contacts by their IDs. Use this to remove individual contacts from the campaign, even if they match other inclusion criteria.

**How to get contact IDs:**
```
GET /api/v1/workspace/{workspace_id}/contacts?limit=50
```
Response: `{"data": [{"id": "contact-uuid", "name": "John",  ...etc}]}`

addition_contact_ids.title: Addition Contact Ids
addition_contact_ids.description:
Force include specific contacts by their IDs. These contacts will be included regardless of label filters. Useful for ensuring VIP contacts are always included.

**How to get contact IDs:**
```
GET /api/v1/workspace/{workspace_id}/contacts?limit=50
```
Response: `{"data": [{"id": "contact-uuid", "name": "Jane",  ...etc}]}`

exclude_any_contact_label_ids.title: Exclude Any Contact Label Ids
exclude_any_contact_label_ids.description: Exclude contacts that have ANY of these labels (OR exclusion logic). If a contact has even one of these labels, they will be excluded from the campaign.

tags.name: Message Campaigns
tags.description: **Multi-Channel Messaging Campaign Management**: Create, schedule, and execute bulk messaging campaigns across SMS, MMS, and WhatsApp Business Platform. Configure campaign settings including send times, rate limits, message content, and channel-specific parameters. Monitor delivery status, track engagement metrics, and analyze campaign performance with cross-channel analytics. Supports immediate sends and scheduled campaigns with timezone handling. Leverage WhatsApp Business templates, rich media messaging, and interactive elements alongside traditional SMS/MMS campaigns. Segment audiences using contact labels for targeted messaging strategies.

tags.name: Call Campaigns
tags.description: **Automated Voice Campaign Management**: Create and execute automated calling campaigns (auto-dialer) powered by AI agents for outbound voice interactions. Configure dialing schedules, call flow logic, and campaign parameters like retry attempts and call timing windows. Monitor real-time campaign progress, track call completion rates, and analyze conversation outcomes. Integrate with AI agents to provide personalized, dynamic conversations at scale while maintaining compliance with calling regulations.

tags.name: AI Agents
tags.description: **AI Agent Management**: List and manage AI agents (conversational bots) available for integration with your campaigns and communication workflows. View AI agent details including names, configuration IDs, and integration types. AI agents can be integrated into voice and messaging campaigns to provide automated, intelligent conversations with customers across different channels.

tags.name: Messaging Services
tags.description: **Messaging Service Provider Configuration**: Configure and manage messaging service providers and communication channels for your campaigns. Set up SMS, MMS, WhatsApp, and other messaging channels with proper authentication and routing. Configure service-specific settings like sender IDs, webhook endpoints, and rate limiting parameters. Switch between multiple messaging providers for redundancy and cost optimization. Monitor channel health and delivery rates.

tags.name: Conversations
tags.description: **Two-Way Conversation Management**: View, manage, and participate in ongoing two-way conversations with customers across all communication channels (SMS, MMS, WhatsApp, voice calls). Access complete conversation history with timestamps, message status, and participant details. Handle conversation routing, assignment to agents, and status management (open, closed, escalated). Search conversations by contact information, keywords, or date ranges. Support real-time conversation monitoring for customer service scenarios.

tags.name: Messages
tags.description: **Individual Message Operations**: Send individual messages outside of campaigns for one-off communications, urgent notifications, or personalized responses. Compose and send SMS, MMS, or rich media messages to specific contacts with real-time delivery confirmation. Handle message replies, track delivery status, and manage message threads. Supports message scheduling and custom sender identification. Ideal for transactional messages, alerts, and ad-hoc communications that don't require full campaign setup.

tags.name: Contact Label
tags.description: **Contact Segmentation and Organization**: Create, manage, and apply labels to organize your contact database into meaningful segments for targeted marketing and communication campaigns. Define custom label categories and use labels for advanced contact filtering and campaign targeting. Support bulk label operations and label-based analytics. Essential for GDPR compliance, marketing segmentation, and personalized communication strategies.

tags.name: Contact
tags.description: **Contact Database Management**: Perform comprehensive CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations on your contact database. Import contacts from CSV files with automatic deduplication and validation. Update contact information, manage custom fields, apply labels, and track contact engagement history. Export contact lists with filtering options, handle contact preferences and opt-out status, and maintain data quality with validation rules.

tags.name: Jobs
tags.description: **Asynchronous Task and Job Management**: Monitor and manage long-running background operations such as contact imports, campaign executions, data exports, and system processing tasks. Check job execution status, view progress percentages, access detailed job logs, and handle job results or error conditions. Supports job queuing, retry mechanisms, and job scheduling. Essential for tracking bulk operations that may take time to complete.

tags.name: Phones
tags.description: **Phone Number and Telephony Management**: Manage your phone number inventory and configure voice calling capabilities for both inbound and outbound communications. Configure phone numbers from various carriers, set up caller ID settings, and configure voice applications and call flows. Handle call routing rules and phone number assignments to campaigns or services. Supports both local and toll-free numbers with carrier-specific configuration options.

tags.name: Voice Call Session
tags.description: **Voice Call Session Analytics**: Access comprehensive call history and aggregated statistics for voice interactions. View detailed call information including duration, participants, call quality metrics, call direction, and session status. Filter calls by type, direction, status, and phone numbers. Search call history by keywords including phone numbers and contact names. Essential for call analytics, performance monitoring, and customer service reporting with historical data analysis.

tags.name: Api Keys
tags.description: **API Authentication Management**: Generate, manage, and secure API keys for programmatic access to the platform with granular permission controls. Create API keys with specific scopes and access levels, implement key rotation policies, and monitor API usage patterns. Handle key revocation, expiration management, and audit trails for security compliance. Support different key types for various integration scenarios including webhook authentication and third-party service integration.

tags.name: Whatsapp Business Platform
tags.description: **WhatsApp Business API Integration**: Integrate with WhatsApp Business Platform to enable WhatsApp messaging capabilities within your communication workflows. Configure WhatsApp Business accounts, manage message templates for different use cases, and handle WhatsApp-specific features like message status callbacks and media attachments. Set up webhook endpoints for real-time message delivery, manage WhatsApp phone number verification, and handle business profile information. Supports rich media messaging and interactive buttons.

tags.name: WABP Campaigns
tags.description: **WhatsApp Business Platform Templates**: Create and send WhatsApp Business Platform (WABP) template messages using pre-approved templates from Meta's template library. Execute template-based campaigns with personalized parameters for body text, headers, and interactive buttons. Send individual template messages with dynamic content substitution and rich media attachments (images, videos, documents). Templates support multilingual content, variable parameters, and must be pre-approved by Meta before use. Essential for WhatsApp Business messaging compliance and delivering structured, professional communications at scale.

tags.name: User Activity
tags.description: **User Activity Tracking and Audit Logging**: Track and audit user actions within the platform for security, compliance, and operational monitoring. Monitor user login patterns, track API usage, log administrative actions, and maintain detailed audit trails of system interactions. Generate compliance reports and provide activity dashboards for security oversight. Support regulatory compliance requirements with secure logging, data retention policies, and automated alerting for security events.
